content: grr pasties designed by catie berger a fast and fun little project to crochet each pair works up in only or so use up your leftover sock and novelty yarns and let your imagination run wild yarn leftover sock/fingering yarn and eyelash yarn shown in opal tiger with and unknown black eyelash yarn from the stash hook us e 3 5mm round 1 chain 2 7sc in first chain slip_stitch into 2nd chain counts as 1st single_crochet 8sc round 2 chain 1 single_crochet in slip_stitch 2sc in each single_crochet around slip_stitch to join 16sc round 3 chain 1 single_crochet in slip_stitch single_crochet in next 2 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet around slip_stitch to join 21sc round 4 chain 1 single_crochet in slip_stitch single_crochet in next 3 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet around slip_stitch to join 26sc round 5 chain 1 single_crochet in slip_stitch single_crochet in next 4sc 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet around slip_stitch to join 31sc round 6 chain 1 single_crochet in slip_stitch single_crochet in next 5sc 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet around slip_stitch to join 36sc round 7 chain 1 single_crochet in each single_crochet around slip_stitch to join 36sc round 8 change to eyelash yarn turn work so that the ws is facing work single_crochet in each single_crochet 36 single_crochet finish off weave in ends embellish with beads tassels glitter etc the finished diameter is approximately 2 5 for smaller pasties omit one or more of the increase rounds 7 - 3 for larger pasties add more increase rounds adding 1 single_crochet between increases
